title: Japanese Chapter 2 Quiz: Hiragana – The Vowel Sounds

questions.question: Which hiragana character represents the sound "a"?
questions.explanation: あ (a) is the first vowel in the Japanese hiragana syllabary.

questions.question: Which hiragana character represents the sound "i"?
questions.explanation: い (i) is the second vowel in the Japanese hiragana syllabary.

questions.question: Which hiragana character represents the sound "u"?
questions.explanation: う (u) is the third vowel in the Japanese hiragana syllabary.

questions.question: Which hiragana character represents the sound "e"?
questions.explanation: え (e) is the fourth vowel in the Japanese hiragana syllabary.

questions.question: Which hiragana character represents the sound "o"?
questions.explanation: お (o) is the fifth and final vowel in the Japanese hiragana syllabary.

How many vowel sounds are there in Japanese hiragana?
questions.explanation: Japanese has five vowel sounds: a, i, u, e, o (あ, い, う, え, お).
